entry.summary: Melody Schwegel of Umpqua Actors Community Theatre talks about the Father Daughter Dance in February, and the upcoming production of Sweeney Todd. In the second segment, Ashley Cluver of Umpqua Valley Art has an update on their new schedule, the new exhibits and upcoming classes.

entry.title: Round Table Pizza Set to Return to Roseburg This Spring
entry.summary: Round Table Pizza is set to return to Roseburg this spring at 2040 NW Stewart Pkwy. FAT Brands confirmed the comeback and says the location plans to hire 25 employees. An exact opening date has not been announced.

entry.title: Fatal Crash on Elkhead Road Near Drain Under Investigation
entry.summary: Douglas County deputies are investigating a fatal two-vehicle crash on Elkhead Road near Drain early Jan. 14. An 89-year-old driver passed away at the scene. A 72-year-old driver was injured and taken to Mercy Medical Center. No intoxicants suspected.

entry.summary: The city of Roseburg is seeking qualified applicants for the Roseburg Budget Committee, Roseburg Homeless Commission and Roseburg Public Works Commission.

entry.title: C&K Market to Close Drain Ray’s Food Place in Late February
entry.summary: C&K Market announced it will close Ray’s Food Place in Drain in late February after “careful consideration.” The employee-owned company said all staff will be offered jobs at other locations, and gift cards and loyalty rewards will remain valid at all Ray’s stores.

entry.title: Umpqua River Lighthouse to Celebrate 132nd Birthday with Open House on Jan. 17
entry.summary: Celebrate the Umpqua River Lighthouse’s 132nd birthday at a free open house Saturday, Jan. 17, 2026, from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. in Winchester Bay. Enjoy refreshments and cake, tour the lighthouse from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m., and explore the museum, gallery, and gift shop.

entry.title: Roseburg Man Jailed on 60 Child Sex Abuse Charges After Winston Police Investigation
entry.summary: Winston Police arrested 21-year-old Lucas Brent Carr of Roseburg on 60 charges of encouraging child sex abuse in the first degree. Police said the case began July 16, 2025, after a tip from the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children. Carr is held without bail.

entry.title: Student Creator Project returns to empower local teens through filmmaking
entry.summary: A long-running youth media program aimed at amplifying teen voices is returning this February under a new name, but with the same mission that has guided it for more than a decade.
